meanings.definition: To waste time or energy on trivial or unimportant tasks.
meanings.sent1: She would always faff around with her phone instead of studying.
meanings.sent2: Don't faff about, we need to finish this project on time.
meanings.sent3: He decided to faff away the afternoon rearranging his bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: The team continued to faff, oblivious to the approaching deadline.
meanings.sent5: Her constant faffing made her fall behind in her work.

meanings.definition: A lot of unnecessary activity or effort.
meanings.sent1: The meeting was just a big faff with no real decisions made.
meanings.sent2: Stop all this faff and let's get down to business.
meanings.sent3: The faff of planning the party was more tiring than the party itself.
meanings.sent4: The faff of bureaucracy slowed down the entire process.
meanings.sent5: The faff of cleaning up after the event took longer than expected.
